D:

* D shifted a bit but knew nothing of what was going on around him. Not even 
knowing that the ship had been destroyed, he simply lay there and was 
unresponsive when Astral took the time to shake his shoulder.
His body wasn�t damaged and neither was his mind, but the simple and organic 
side of his functioning�s had made sure that he had passed out from the 
pressure of the ship.
And even as he was lifted into the air D failed to respond, until the sudden 
feeling of weightlessness hit his mind like a tone of bricks!
D�s eyes opened slightly as he suddenly saw a bot rise up from him, barely 
noticing that she was actually staying in one spot and HE was dropping!
When Starlight finally caught him his eyes snapped open and he flailed in 
the air, scrabbling with his clawed hand-like paws. Trying to get a hold on 
her for fright of being in an experience he had never been in before. D�s 
feet had always been on the ground.
He whined and struggled, his technological spark beating like wild fire in 
his large chest. He was frightened and with his sheer size he could pull 
them both down if he continued struggling as he was. But he had never been 
any more then 5 feet off the ground and he didn�t know this.
D looked up at Starlight; his ears pressed flat against his head and his 
claws trying to dig in to make sure he didn�t fall. Even though he was 
relatively safe. His mind was reeling. *
